product_name: First Aid BeautyRetinol Eye Cream with Squalane + Ceramides
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingGive BackFirst Aid Beauty's Retinol Eye Cream with Squalane + Ceramides hydrates to visibly smooth fine lines + wrinkles around the eye area's most delicate skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsDesigned with sensitive skin in mindFeatures Encapsulated Retinol Technology with a slow-release delivery system to visibly smooth the eye area with less redness + irritationContains Squalane + Ceramides to hydrate, calm, soothe + strengthen the moisture barrierKey IngredientsEncapsulated Retinol Technology ‚Äì Gently releases retinol over time to help smooth look of fine linesSqualane - Helps hydrate to soften skin and keeps moisture locked inFormulated WithoutParabensFragranceSulfateGlutenTalcPhthalatesItem 2617639How To UseAfter cleansing, apply over the entire orbital eye area in the AM and PM.Precautions: Avoid direct contact with eyes. If contact occurs, rinse eyes with water. If skin irritation develops, reduce frequency or discontinue use. Recommended to use with an SPF product.IngredientsAqua (Water, Eau), Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Glycerin, Squalane, Butylene Glycol, Glyceryl Stearate, Saccharomyces Ferment, Dimethicone, Glyceryl Stearate Citrate, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Retinol, Atelocollagen, Caffeine, Ceramide Ng, Sodium Hyaluronate, Magnesium Ascorbyl Phosphate, Allantoin, Avena Sativa (Oat) Kernel Extract, Cholesterol, Linoleic Acid, Tocopherol, Oleic Acid, Palmitic Acid, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice Powder, Sodium Chondroitin Sulfate, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Humulus Lupulus (Hops) Extract, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, 1,2-Hexanediol, Phytosteryl Canola Glycerides, Cera Carnauba (Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, Cire De Carnauba), Caprylyl Glycol, Butylene/Ethylene/Styrene Copolymer, Cetyl Alcohol, Ethylene/Propylene/Styrene Copolymer, Hydrogenated Poly(C6-12 Olefin), Lauroyl Lysine, Triolein, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Pentylene Glycol, Lecithin, Maltodextrin, Stearic Acid, Stearyl Alcohol, Dipropylene Glycol, Sclerotium Gum, Polyglyceryl-3 Stearate, Disodium Cocoamphodiacetate, Octanediol, Ethyl Ferulate, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Propanediol, Steareth-30, Polysorbate 20, Xanthan Gum, Citric Acid, Chlorphenesin, Phenoxyethanol, Mica, Tin Oxide, CI 77891 (Titanium Dioxide).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: After cleansing, apply over the entire orbital eye area in the AM and PM.Precautions: Avoid direct contact with eyes. If contact occurs, rinse eyes with water. If skin irritation develops, reduce frequency or discontinue use. Recommended to use with an SPF product.

reviews.headline: LOVE
reviews.comments: I have extremely sensitive skin, especially around my eyes, but this eye cream is great. I will say the product burned the first & second time using it, like a tingling sensation, but it didn't cause any redness or irritation besides that feeling. I also do wish it came in a bigger size, but a little product goes a long way!

reviews.headline: Great!
reviews.comments: So I have very sensitive skin and the retinol alternatives I tried proved to be too harsh. On a whim I said "Hey, let's try the stuff these are supposed to take the place of," and am so happy I did. This product doesn't bother my eyes at all and after 2 months of use I can see a significant improvement to my droopy eyelid.

reviews.headline: Disappointing and irritating to my eyes
reviews.comments: I can feel it is working to tighten but i cannot get past the gritty feeling when its applied. I have found after using it more often my eyes have become sensitive to it. I wake up with puffiness around my eyes causing bags. My eyes are also res and clearly irriteted. I think ill go back to the hydrating eye cream as ive had much more success using that product than this one.

reviews.headline: Burn-y
reviews.comments: Made my eyes burn constantly and skin nore sensitive :(

reviews.headline: Burns
reviews.comments: Ive been using this for about a week and this eye cream burns when i apply it & also ive noticed it starts peeling.

reviews.headline: I am very satisfied
reviews.comments: My skin has become very dry with age. I purchased the bounce boost serum, retinol eye cream and the ultra repair cream to use together. On top of helping with the dry issue, it is doing a good job on the wrinkles. I am very satisfied with the results!

reviews.headline: Go back to old formula
reviews.comments: Still gentle, but definitely too much pilling with this new formula. It just pilled or flaked off when I put my eye shadow on. Also felt like my eyelids weren't as lifted. Not happy.

reviews.headline: Not for sensitive skin
reviews.comments: Despite claims of being for sensitive skin it, it had the opposite affect on me. It caused burning and dried out my skin.

reviews.headline: Made my under eyes burn
reviews.comments:
I definitely believe this worked for all those who gave it a good review but I used it on my undereyes for 3 days (only at night) and had to stop bc it made my skin burn so bad. 
For me, it surprisingly wasnt red at all but when I'd put on any other products my undereyes would burn. This continued for 4ish days after I'd stopped using it. 
Maybe I have more sensitive skin than I thought, maybe it was from combining it with other products I use, I dont know. But the glow recipe avocado melt retinol eye cream doesn't do this to me. Maybe it's the concentration of retinol? I've had this experience with one other retinol product in the past. 
So if you've ever experienced burning from retinol, you might want to skip this one.

reviews.headline: Not for sensitive skin as they say it is
reviews.comments: I'm disappointed. I've been using their Retinol eye cream with triple hyaluronic acid for a year now. When I saw this new one I decided to try it since it also says that it's suitable for sensitive skin. I woke up with redness all around my eyes and a burning sensation whenever I washed my face or touched the area. The skin around my eyes was like that for about 5 days.  I only used it that one time and put it back in the box.  Hoping I can return it. I'm back to using the little bit I have left of their old formula and have NO issues with that one.

reviews.headline: Not for Sensitive Undereyes
reviews.comments: I tried this looking for a new eye cream, but it made my eyes burn. I woke up this morning with red undereyes. I hope it works better for someone else, but its not for me. üò£

faceoff_positive.comments:
I can't get enough of eye creams, especially the older I get. Recently I was able to try a First Aid Beauty Retinol Eye Cream With Squalane and Ceramides complimentary from First Aid Beauty for my honest review. I already was a huge fan of FAB and am now even more so! This retinol eye cream is designed for sensitive skin, so it's great for all skin types! I love this as retinol can be harsh, so having one for sensitive skin, you know it's gentle! ‚õëÔ∏è

I'm an avid retinol user who has really dry skin, so I have to be careful and watch my skin as many can make my dry skin worse. This FAB Retinol Eye Cream is so gentle, yet powerful and not only hydrates but also smooths my fine lines, wrinkles and crows feet. I don't deal with any flaking, irritation or dryness. It contains encapsulated retinol which slowly releases the retinol, making it less harsh for skin. ‚õëÔ∏è

The squalane and ceramides help to hydrate, soothe, calm and strengthen my skins moisture barrier. I've always been a fan of First Aid Beauty for their cruelty free, clean and dermatologist tested skincare. As always I am impressed with this retinol eye cream as it not only battles my fine lines and wrinkles around my eyes, but also hydrated and soothes my skin so well at the same time. ‚õëÔ∏è

My skin soaks this right up and stays hydrated. I'm really loving using this during these colder months as usually this is when retinols can irritate my eyes more. This eye cream is the perfect addition to my all FAB skincare routine! ‚õëÔ∏è
faceoff_positive.headline: Great On Sensitive Eyes ‚õëÔ∏è

faceoff_negative.comments:
I definitely believe this worked for all those who gave it a good review but I used it on my undereyes for 3 days (only at night) and had to stop bc it made my skin burn so bad. 
For me, it surprisingly wasnt red at all but when I'd put on any other products my undereyes would burn. This continued for 4ish days after I'd stopped using it. 
Maybe I have more sensitive skin than I thought, maybe it was from combining it with other products I use, I dont know. But the glow recipe avocado melt retinol eye cream doesn't do this to me. Maybe it's the concentration of retinol? I've had this experience with one other retinol product in the past. 
So if you've ever experienced burning from retinol, you might want to skip this one.
faceoff_negative.headline: Made my under eyes burn

rollup.name: Retinol Eye Cream with Squalane + Ceramides
